text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen now dips 
are a huge part of Thai cuisine and there's a

family of dips called Nam prik now the reason 
why you won't find too many restaurants with

nam prik on the menu is because numb prick 
tend to be a bit of an acquired taste and many

of them are really really spicy so restaurants 
or shy away from those but I want to introduce

you guys to numb prick so today I want to share 
with you a recipe that I consider a beginner's

numb prick no weird ingredients easy to make 
easy to love let's get started so the number

ik I am making today is called Nam prik gunshots 
so gong is shrimp and thought means fresh and we

say fresh shrimp to distinguish it from dried 
shrimp which we often use in them prick as well

so I've got here some garlic and I left the peel 
on no need to peel them now and some shallot that

I cut into quarters chilies now you can make 
this as spicy or mild as you want but I like

to stick with chilies that are bit pulpy so some 
bigger ones you can use small Thai chilies but

the problem is with those you won't get a lot of 
color to come through it'll still taste good just

won't look as nice okay and this one it's frozen 
I took it straight out of the freezer and I cut

it in half just so it's easier to broil so I'm 
going to broil these in the oven until they're

toasted and charred you can also barbeque these 
if you've got a grill handy I would skewer the

garlic together though so that way they don't 
fall through the grate all right so put these

in and they won't take very long however they're 
not going to finish at the same time so I think

the chilies will probably finish first so just 
make sure you keep an eye on them and take them

off as they start to toast all right so now what 
I'm going to do is I'm going to remove the garlic

because they are done and some of the shallots 
as well and we'll stick the chilies back in so

I was wrong the garlic is going to finish first 
and just at this stage it already smells amazing

okay that's good enough all right so now I'm going 
to pound these herbs in my mortar and pestle but

first I'm going to just cut my chilies so it's a 
little bit more manageable especially the skin is

the part that's hard to pound and then I'm going 
to throw in all my shallots as well and the great

part about peeling the garlic now is the roasting 
makes the peel come off super easily and now it

gets really easy from here I'm going to pound all 
this into a paste alright so once it's creamy like

this no more big chunks I'm going to add some 
palm sugar and the palm sugar is actually going

to create a little friction and help any sort 
of stubborn bits of pieces alright so now I'm

going to add the star of the dip which is the 
shrimp so these shrimp I have just seared them

until they're cooked if you're already grilling 
the herbs you can definitely grill these as well

even better get a little smokiness going you can 
broil them in the oven if you want to but I like

to sear so I get a little bit of a caramelization 
in there and I'm going to pound these in this dip

as well so yes don't buy expensive shrimp for this 
you just want to make sure there are no more big

chunks but it's nice to get little chunks you 
can tell they're shrimp in there so almost done

I'm going to go in with my seasoning now very 
classic seasoning I've got some fish sauce and

some lime juice for some sour and I like to add 
a little bit of tamarind now you can just do lime

juice but I just find that doing a little bit 
of tamarind just makes it a little bit more less

sharp right because tamarins acidity is a little 
bit more well-rounded so of course you want this

to have a nice dip consistency not too running up 
too thick perfect so numb prick in Thailand are

always served with vegetables lots of vegetables 
and they can be raw or cooked and if you want to

cook them just quickly blanch them in boiling 
water boiled eggs medium boiled eggs is also

something that terrifically with dips especially 
this one we like to serve dips with rice as well

dips are usually a part of a bigger meal so 
the meal will always have rice so sometimes

they'll put the dip right on rice and I saved one 
shrimp my prettiest shrimp as a garnish and voila

just so people know to when there's allergies 
and whatnot that there's definitely shrimp in

there all right let's try this I'm gonna try a 
little bit of the cucumber the flavor of this

dip I have to warn you is very strong so if it's 
your first time having them quick just a little

bit first mmm so good Wow that to me it's just 
the flavor of rustic home cooking it's simple

and all the flavors are really familiar sweet 
salty sour the garlic is no longer pungent it's

super creamy and it's really quite amazing how 
all those simple flavors can combine and become

something that's more complex and super delicious 
so I encourage you to give this num frig a try if

you're ready for the hard core stuff and you've 
got my cookbook I have one recipe in there that

you can try out it's called num break upbeat 
and definitely let me know what you think the

recipe for this will be on hot Thai kitchen 
calm when you make it send me a photo and let

me know how you like it on Facebook Twitter or 
Instagram and if you haven't subscribed to the

show you can click right here and so you'll 
never miss an episode and I will see you next

time for your next finishes tiny garlic and 
the shallots oh don't they don't fall through

the grate great skewer the garlic together so 
that they don't fall through the get the gate

it's a really hard work to this fall through 
the gates great okay great great great great
